natural solution: We can write \[\frac{1}{n^2+n} = \frac{(n+1) - n}{n(n+1)} = \frac{1}{n} - \frac{1}{n+1}.\]Thus, the sum telescopes: \[\sum_{n=1}^{1000} \frac{1}{n^2+n} = \left(\frac11-\frac12\right)+\left(\frac12-\frac23\right)+\dots+\left(\frac1{1000}-\frac1{1001}\right) = \frac11-\frac1{1001} = \boxed{\frac{1000}{1001}}.\]
